HOW DARE YOU. I expect you to go straight glass cannon and hard engage the enemy the second you get back to lane. It worked well the last 2 times, clearly it will work better this time.

Most people think you set yourself even further back on gold by not forging ahead with damage against a foe who has been outplaying you. They expect your positioning to improve enough not to die to the enemy's gold lead, which usually isn't realistic by the time they have that 1 or 2k gold lead.

This argument is pretty dumb all around but is somewhat valid in solo queue, in that you will never get enough concentrated ganks to catch up both the money lost from losing lane AND the money lost from building tank stats, after having lost a lane since the enemy top laner will start roaming. In an actual 5v5 where the jungler is your friend, the jungler can tell the other lanes to play conservatively while he camps yours to deny the enemy laner farm.

It's a tough call, since in solo queue if you deviate from build paths for any reason you get spammed with reports.

> [{quoted}](name=scrimbul,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ie4ygGEA,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-03T22:14:46.345+0000)
>
>AND the money lost from building tank stats

This is just wrong. Money spent on tank stats is not a wasted money - especially if you play champion like Gnar, whose scalings are somewhat underwhelming (Mini-Q: 115%, Mega-Q: 120%, Mega-W: 100%, R: 20% Bonus AD (increses by half if you hit a wall)). Really, outside of his Mega-Q his abilities scale terrible (especially ultimate - you know how much Bonus AD you need in order to increase his ultimate damage by half? Exactly 1 000 bonus AD - Lee for comparison needs 150 bonus AD) and he even have 1 Health scaling ability which further increases the effectivness of tank stats on Gnar.

Also, important fact - having lower damage output but surviving long enough to deal it is better than having higher damage output but dying before you can deal it. You need to find a perfect balance here - and no, it doesn't mean that Tank stats are wasted, they are just as needed as offensive stats.

The problem with the "build defensively when behind and offensively when ahead," isn't always the literal build tanky when behind and damage when ahead. Some champs like an ADC when behind should probably be building sustain such as {{item:3072}} instead of rushing the even more expensive {{item:3031}} when you need the sustain more then and now. 


However, when talking about tanks and bruisers OP you would be correct and did the right thing. I can't count how many times I have seen a {{champion:75}} still try to rush his {{item:3078}} when he is getting dumpstered in lane, and should really be building a {{item:3065}} or {{item:3025}} instead. 

In short, building defensively is not just building tank items, but rather sustain or more cost efficient items when behind.

While this is not helpful to solve your problem: If you are being flamed, that just means someone is feeling very passionatly about you. Better than indifference, isn't it?  :P

In general you should know already that people like to flame for no reason at all. It distractes from their own mistakes, because they are obviously faultless.

The standard fighter build lately is Tri Force/BorK/the rest are tank items like Randuins/Banshee's Veil. It doesn't pay off these days to skip tri force or BorK due to how cost-inneficient tank items are by themselves.

Don't quote me on this, this was based on LCS builds which may be less applicable in YoloQ.

Start with Dorans Blade. This gives you some sustain in the Earliest stages of the game. If your opponent is AP, get an Early Hex drinker. This should allow for better dueling against AP. But after that, you should focus tank stats. Gnar is the teams tank.

The problem I have with Gnar building offensive stats is that he requires too many things. Mini form is auto attack reliant, while his mega form is Ability reliant. You can't afford to build both AS and CDR.

Well, there's {{item:3142}} , an item for pretty much all your offensive needs.
AD, armor pen, crit chance & CDR as well as an AS/MS active with good build paths.
AS and MS being actives also helps building up Gnar's rage on demand.

Whenever I want something offensive with Gnar, I usually pick that one up.
But then again, I'm not an LCS player.
